page.title: 12New building work in Gayton
page.content: At the time of last census in 1981, the population of Gayton stood at 495 with 112 people (approx. one quarter) under the age of 18. As these children grow up and marry, many who wish to will not be able to stay in Gayton. The main reason is that the houses are so expensive. Over the last two years, the cheapest house to be offered for sale was 62,000 pounds and even a small terraced cottage wouldn't sell for under 60,000 pounds. These would be outside the price range of most first time buyers. Because a "Green Belt" surrounds Gayton the only houses being built are those on the sites of those previously demolished or in gardens of existing ones. In 1981 there were 179 dwellings in the village - this is not likely to increase by many in the future.
